title: 上部 面壁者 第11节
paragraphs: 太空军政治部工作会议。
宣布开会后，常伟思长时间地沉默着，这是以前从未有过的。他的目光穿过会议桌旁两排政治部军官，看着无限远方，手中的铅笔轻轻地顿着桌面，那哒哒的轻响仿佛是他思维的脚步。终于，他把自己从深思中拉回来。

“同志们，昨天军委的命令已经公布，由我兼任军种政治部主任。一个星期前我就接到了任命，但直到现在我们坐在一起，才有了一种复杂的感觉。我突然发现，自己面对的，是太空军中最艰难的一批人，而我，现在是你们中的一员了。以前，没有体会到这一点，向大家表示歉意。”说到这里，常伟思推开了面前的文件。“会议的这一部分不做记录，同志们，我们推心置腹地交流一下，现在，我们都做一次三体人，让大家看到自己的思想，这对我们以后的工作很重要。”
常伟思的目光在每一位军官的脸上都停留了一两秒钟，他们沉默着，没有人说话。常伟思站起来，绕过会议桌，在一排正襟危坐的军官后面踱着步。
“我们的职责，就是使部队对未来的战争建立必胜的信念，那么，我们自己有这种信念吗？有的请举手，记住，我们是在谈心。”
没有人举手，几乎所有与会者的眼睛都看着桌面。但常伟思注意到，有一个人的目光坚定地平视着前方，他是章北海。
常伟思接着说：“那么，认为有胜利的可能性呢？注意，我说的可能性不是百分之零点几的偶然，而是真正有意义的可能性。”
章北海举起一只手，也只有他一人举手。媚者无疆小说
“首先谢谢同志们的坦诚。”常伟思说，接着转向章北海，“很好，章北海同志，谈谈你是如何建立这种信心的。”奋斗者 侯沧海商路笔记
章北海站起来，常伟思示意他坐下：“这不是正式会议，我们只是谈谈心。”
章北海仍然立正站着：“首长，您的问题我一两句话说不清楚，毕竟，信念的建立是一个漫长而复杂的过程。我在这里首先想指出的是目前部队中的错误思潮。大家知道，在三体危机之前，我们一直主张用科学和理性的眼光审视未来战争。这种思维方式以其强大的惯性延续到现在，特别是目前的太空军，有大批学者和科学家加入，更加剧了这种思潮。如果用这种思维方式去思考四个世纪后的星际战争，我们永远无法建立起胜利的信念。”
“章北海同志的话很奇怪，”一名上校说，“坚定的信念难道不是建立在科学和理性之上的吗？不以客观事实为基础建立的信念是不可能牢固的。”
“那我们首先要重新审视科学和理性，要明白，这只是我们的科学和理性。
三体文明的发展高度告诉我们，我们的科学只是海边拾贝的孩子，真理的大海可能还没有见到。所以，我们在自己的科学和理性指导下看到的事实未必是真正的客观事实，既然如此，我们就应该学会有选择地忽略它，我们应该看到事物在发展变化中，不能用技术决定论和机械唯物论把未来一步看死。”
“很好。”常伟思点点头，鼓励他说下去。
“胜利的信念是必须建立的，这种信念，是军队责任和尊严的基础！我军曾经在极端困难的条件下，面对强敌，以对祖国和人民的责任感建立了对胜利坚定的信念；我相信，在今天，对全人类和地球文明的责任感也能支撑起这样的信念。”
“但具体到部队的思想工作，我们又如何去做呢？”一名军官说，“太空军的成分很复杂，这也决定了部队思想的复杂，以后我们的工作会很难的。”

“我认为，目前至少应该从部队的精神状态做起。”章北海说，“从大处说，上星期我到刚归属本军种的空军和海军航空兵部队调研，发现这些部队的日常训练已经十分松弛了；从小处说，部队的军容军纪也出现越来越多的问题，昨天是统一换夏装的日子，可在总部机关居然有很多人还穿着冬季军装。这种精神状态必须尽快改变。看看现在，太空军正在变成一个科学院。当然，不可否认它目前正在承担一个军事科学院的使命，但我们应该首先意识到自己是军队，而且是处于战争状态的军队！”
谈话又进行了一些时间，常伟思坐回自己的位置上：“谢谢大家，希望以后我们能够一直这样坦诚交流。下面，我们进入正式的会议内容。”常伟思说着，一抬头，又遇上了章北海的目光，沉稳中透着坚毅，令他感到一丝宽慰。
章北海，我知道你是有信念的，你有那样的父亲，不可能没有信念，但事情肯定没有你说的那么简单，我不知道你的信念是如何建立的，甚至不知道这种信念中还包含着什么更多的内容，就像你父亲，我敬佩他，但得承认，到最后也没有看透他。
常伟思翻开了面前的文件，“目前，太空战争理论的研究全面展开，但很快遇到了问题：星际战争研究无疑是要以技术发展水平为基准的，但现在，各项基础研究都刚刚开始，技术突破还遥遥无期。这使得我们的研究失去了依托。为了适应这种情况，总部修改了研究规划，把原来单一的太空战争理论研究分成独立的三部分，以适应未来人类世界可能达到的各种技术层次，它们分别是：低技术战略、中技术战略和高技术战略。”
“目前，对三个技术层次的界定工作正在进行，将在各主要学科内确定大量的指标参数，但其核心的参数是万吨级宇宙飞船的速度和航行范围。”
“低技术层次：飞船的速度达到第三宇宙速度的50倍左右，即800公里/秒左右，飞船不具备生态循环能力。在这种情况下，飞船的作战半径将限制在太阳系内部，即海王星轨道以内，距太阳30个天文单位的空间范围里。”
“中技术层次：飞船的速度达到第三宇宙速度的300倍左右，即4800公里/秒，飞船具有部分生态循环能力。在这种情况下，飞船的作战半径将扩展至柯伊伯带（太阳系边缘含有许多小冰晶的盘状区域，距太阳30－100天文单位。）以外，距太阳1000个天文单位以内的空间。”
“高技术层次：飞船的速度达到第三宇宙速度的1000倍左右，即16000公里／秒，也就是光速的百分之五；飞船具有完全生态循环能力。在这种情况下，飞船的作战航行范围将扩展至奥尔特星云（包围太阳系的球体云团，布满大量不活跃的彗星。），初步具备恒星际航行能力。”
“失败主义是对太空武装力量的最大威胁，所以太空军的政治思想工作者肩负着极其重大的使命，军种政治部要全面参与太空军事理论的研究，在基础理论领域清除失败主义的污染，保证正确的研究方向。”
“今天到会的同志，都将成为太空战争理论课题组的成员。三个理论分支的研究虽然有重合的部分，但研究机构是相互独立的，这三个机构名称暂定为低技术战略研究室，中技术战略研究室和高技术战略研究室，今天这次会议，就是想听听各位自己的选择意向，作为军种政治部下一步工作岗位安排的参考。下面大家都谈谈自己的选择吧。”
与会的三十二名政治部军官中，有二十四人选择低技术战略研究室，七人选择中技术战略研究室，选择高技术战略研究室的只有章北海一人。
“看来，北海同志是立志成为一名科幻爱好者了。”有人说，引出一些笑声。
“我选择的是胜利的唯一希望，只有达到这一技术层次，人类才有可能建立有效的地球和太阳系防御系统。”章北海说。
“现在连可控核聚变都没有掌握，把万吨战舰推进到光速的百分之五？让这些庞然大物比现在人类那些卡车大小的飞船还要快上一千倍？这连科幻都不是，是奇幻吧。”
“不是还有四个世纪吗？要用发展的眼光看问题。”
“可是物理学基础理论已经不可能再发展了。”

“现有理论的应用潜力可能连百分之一都还没有挖掘出来。”章北海说，“我感觉，现在最大的问题是科技界的研究战略，他们在低端技术上耗费大量资源和时间。以宇宙发动机为例，裂变发动机根本就没有必要搞，可现在，不但投入巨大的开发力量，甚至还在投入同样的力量去研究新一代的化学发动机！应该直接集中资源研究聚变发动机，而且应该越过工质型的，直接开发无工质聚变发动机（工质型核聚变发动机与化学火箭类似，是核聚变的能量推动有质量的工质，产生反推力推进飞船；无工质型核聚变发动机则是用核聚变辐射能量直接推进飞船。前者需要飞船携带推进工质，当远程航行长时间加速或减速时，工质的需要量将非常巨大，因而工质型发动机不可能进行星际远航。）。在其他研究领域，也存在着同样的问题，比如全封闭生态圈是恒星际远航飞船所必需的技术，而且对物理学基础理论依赖较少，可现在的研究规模也很有限。”

常伟思说：“章北海同志至少提出了一个值得重视的问题：目前军方和科技界都在忙于全面启动自己的工作，相互之间沟通不够。好在双方都意识到了这种状况，正在组织一个军方和科技界的联席会议，同时军方和科学院已成立专门机构，加强双方的交流，使太空战略研究和科技研究形成充分的互动关系。下一步，我们将向各研究领域派出大量军代表，同时，也将有大批科学家介入太空战争理论研究。还是那句话：我们不能消极等待技术突破，而应该尽快形成自己的战略思想体系，对各领域的研究产生推动。这里，还要谈谈另一层关系：太空军和面壁者之间的关系。”
“面壁者？”有人很吃惊地问，“他们要干涉太空军的工作吗？”
“目前还没有这个迹象，只有泰勒提出要到我军进行考察。但我们也应该清楚，他们在这方面是有一定权力的，如果干涉真的出现，可能对我们的工作产生意想不到的影响。应该有这方面的思想准备，在这种情况真的出现时，应保持面壁计划和主流防御之间的某种平衡。”
散会后，常伟思一人坐在空荡的会议室中，他点上一支烟，烟雾飘进一束由窗户透入的阳光中，像是燃烧起来一样。
不管怎么样，一切总算开始了。他对自己说。
罗辑第一次体会到了梦想成真的感觉。他本以为伽尔宁的承诺是吹牛，当然能找到一个原生态的很美的地方，但与他的想象中的所在肯定有很大差别。可是当他走下直升机时，感觉就是走进了自己的梦想：远方的雪山、面前的湖泊、湖边的草原和森林，连位置都和他给伽尔宁画出来的一样。特别是这里的纯净，是他以前不敢想象的，一切像是刚从童话中搬出来一样，清新的空气有淡淡的甜味。
连太阳都似乎小心翼翼，把它光芒中最柔和最美丽的一部分撒向这里。最不可思议的是，湖边真的有一座以一幢别墅为中心的小庄园。据同行的坎特说，这幢建筑建于十九世纪中叶，但看上去更古老些，岁月留下的沧桑已使它与周围的环境融为一体。
“不要吃惊，人有时候会梦到真实存在的地方。”坎特说。
“这里有居民吗？”罗辑问。
“方圆五公里内没有，再向外有一些小村落。”
罗辑猜想，这个地方可能在北欧，但他没有问。
坎特领着罗辑走进别墅，宽大的欧式风格的客厅里，罗辑一眼就看到了那个壁炉，旁边整齐地摆放着生火的果木，散发出一股清香。

“别墅的原主人向你问好，他很荣幸能有一位面壁者住在这里。”坎特说，接着他告诉罗辑，除了他要求的那些设施外，庄园里还有更多的东西：一个有十匹马的马厩，因为到雪山方向散步，骑马最好；还有一个网球场和一个高尔夫球场，一个酒窖，湖上有一艘机动游艇和几只小帆船。外表古老的别墅内部很现代化，每个房间都有电脑，宽带网络和卫星电视等一应俱全，还有一间数字电影放映室。除此之外，罗辑来时还注意到那个直升机停机坪显然不是临时建的。
“这人很有钱吧？”
“岂止有钱，他不愿透露身份，否则我说出他的名字你可能知道。……他已经把这块土地赠送给联合国，比洛克菲勒送的那一块大多了。所以现在要明确，这块土地和其上的不动产都属于联合国，你只有居住权。但你也得到了不少：主人临走时说，他自己的物品已经都拿走了，这别墅里剩下的东西都送给你了，别的不说，这几幅画大概就很值钱。”
坎特带着罗辑察看别墅的各个房间，罗辑看到这里的原主人有不俗的品位，每个房间的布置都给人一种高雅的宁静感。书房里的书相当部分是拉丁文的旧版。房间里的那些画，大多是现代派风格的，但与这古典气息很浓的房间并无不协调之感。罗辑特别注意到这里一幅风景画都没有，这是很成熟的审美情调：这幢房子就坐落在绝美的伊甸园中，风景画挂在这里就像往大海中加一桶水那样多余。
回到客厅后。罗辑坐到壁炉前那张十分舒适的摇椅上，一伸手从旁边的小桌上摸到了一样东西，拿起来一看是一个烟斗，有着欧式烟斗很少见的又长又细的斗柄，是有闲阶级使用的室内型。他看着墙上一处处的白色方框，想象着那些刚刚摘走的都是些什么。
这时，坎特领进来几个人并对罗辑做了介绍，他们是管家、厨师、司机、马夫、游艇驾驶员等等，都是曾为以前的主人服务的。这些人走后，坎特又介绍了一位负责这里安全的穿便装的中校军官，他走后，罗辑问坎特史强现在在哪里。
“他已经移交了你的安全保卫工作，现在可能回国了吧。”
“让他来代替刚才那个中校，我觉得他更胜任。”
“我也有这种感觉，但他不懂英语，工作不方便。”
“那就把这里的警卫人员都换成中国人。”
坎特答应去联系一下，转身出去了。
罗辑也走出了房间，穿过修饰得十分精致的草坪，走上一座通向湖中的栈桥，在栈桥的尽头，他扶着栏杆，看着如镜的潮面上雪山的倒影，周围是清甜的空气和明媚的阳光。罗辑对自己说：与现在的生活相比，四百多年后的世界算什么？
去他妈的面壁计划。
“怎么能让这个杂种进入这里？”终端前的一名研究人员低声说。
“面壁者当然可以进来。”旁边另一位低声回答。
“平淡无奇是吗，大概让您失望了吧，总统先生？”洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室主任艾伦博士领着雷迪亚兹走过一排排电脑终端时说。
“我已经不是总统了。”雷迪亚兹正色说道，同时四下张望。
“这里就是核武器模拟中心之一，这样的中心洛斯阿拉莫斯有四个，劳仑斯利弗莫尔有三个。”
雷迪亚兹看到两个稍微不那么平淡无奇的东西，那玩意儿看上去很新，有一个很大的显示屏，控制台上还有许多精致的手柄，他凑过去细看，艾伦轻轻把他拉了回来：“那是游戏机，这里的终端和电脑都不能玩游戏，所以放了两个让大家休息时放松。”
雷迪亚兹又看到另外两个不太平淡无奇的东西，结构透明且很复杂，里面有液体在动荡，他又过去看，这次艾伦笑着摇摇头，没有制止他，“那个是加湿器，新墨西哥州的气候很干燥；那个，只是自动咖啡机而已……麦克，给雷迪亚兹先生倒一杯咖啡。不，不要从这里面倒，去我办公室里倒上等咖啡豆煮的。”
雷迪亚兹只好看墙上那些放得很大的黑白照片了，他认出上面一个戴礼帽叼烟斗的瘦子是奥本海默，但艾伦还是指给他看那些平淡无奇的终端机。
“这些显示器太旧了。”雷迪亚兹说。
“但它们后面是世界上最强大的计算机，每秒可以进行五百万亿次浮点运算。”
这时，一名工程师来到艾伦面前：“博士，AD44530G模型这次走通了。”
“很好。”
工程师的声音压低了些：“输出模块我们暂停了。”说着看了一眼雷迪亚兹。
“运行。”艾伦说着，转向雷迪亚兹，“您看，我们对面壁者没有什么隐瞒的。”
这时，雷迪亚兹听到了一阵嘶嘶啦啦的声音，他看到终端前的人们手中都在撕纸，以为这些人是在销毁文件，嘟囔道：“你们没有碎纸机吗？”但他随后看到，有人撕的是空白打印纸。不知是谁喊了一声：“Over”所有人都在一阵欢呼声中把撕碎的纸片抛向空中，使得本来就杂乱的地板更像垃圾堆了。
“这是模拟中心的一个传统。当年第一颗核弹爆炸时，费米博士曾将一把碎纸片撒向空中，依据它们在冲击波中飘行的距离准确地计算出了核弹的当量。现在当每个模型计算通过时，我们也这么做一次。”
雷迪亚兹拂着头上和肩上的纸片说：“你们每天都在进行核试验，这事儿对你们来说就像玩电子游戏那么方便，但我们就不行了，我们没有超级计算机，只能试真的……干同样的事，惹人讨厌的总是穷人。”
“雷迪亚兹先生，这里的人对政治都没有兴趣。”
雷迪亚兹依次凑近几台终端细看，上面只有滚动的数据和变幻的曲线，好不容易看到图形和图像，也是抽象的一团，看不出是什么。当雷迪亚兹又凑近一台终端时，坐在前面的那名物理学家抬起头说：“总统先生，您想看到蘑菇云吗，没有的。”
“我不是总统。”雷迪亚兹在接过麦克递来的咖啡时重申道。

translated_paragraphs: Conference of the Political Department of the Space Force.

After the meeting announced, Chang Wei Si was silent for a long time. This is something that has never happened before. His gaze passed through the desks on both sides of his political officers, and he looked far away in the distance with a pen resting gently on the table. The tapping sound seemed to be his thoughts moving. Finally, he pulled himself out of deep thought.

$$“Comrades, the command from the Central Military Commission has been published. From a week ago, I received the appointment as director of the political department of my own military branch and, until now, we sit here and feel a complicated feeling. It occurs to me suddenly that I am facing the most difficult people in our space army, but I am now one of you.”$$“I apologize for not being able to better understand your feelings earlier,” said Chang Weisu. “Meeting has no records from this point onwards. The comrades, let’s exchange thoughts openly and honestly without reservation. This is very important for our work in the future.”
He looked at each officer's face for a second or two, they were silent and nobody spoke. He stood up and walked around the conference table behind the officers seated with bent backs.
Our responsibility is to instill the belief that our troops can win future wars. Do we ourselves have this belief? Please raise your hand, remembering that it is a discussion among us only.

No one raised their hands, and the eyes of almost all in attendance were fixed on the desk. However, Chang Binghai noticed that the eyes of a certain man were fixed forward steadily; he was Chang Binghai himself.
Then, did you think there was a chance of success? Remember, I said the chance was not a minuscule accidental probability but a truly meaningful chance.
Chapter North Sea raised his hand, and only he himself was raising it.
First of all, thank you for your honesty.
Zhang Beihai stood up and Cang WeiSi gestured for him to sit down: “This is not a formal meeting; we are just talking.”

Chapter Beihai still stood up straight and said, "Firstly, I would like to point out the wrong trends in the army now. Everyone knows that we have long maintained the viewpoint that scientific and rational analysis should be used to inspect future warfare. This mindset has its own momentum and continues even today, especially with a large number of scholars and scientists joining the Space Force, making this trend stronger. If we use such thinking to analyze the four-century-long interplanetary war, we will never be able to build up our faith in victory."
“Chang Baihai's words are strange, ” said the colonel. "A firm belief is not built on scientific and rational foundations, isn’t it? Belief that doesn't rely on objective facts cannot be stable."
First, we need to reassess science and reasonableness, to understand that this is only our scientific and reasonable.

The development of the Three-Body Civilization tells us that our science is only a child playing on the seashore, and the truthful ocean might not have been seen. Therefore, what we see as fact may not be true. Since this is so, we should learn to choose to ignore it. We should see things changing and developing, and cannot use technological determinism or mechanical materialism to predict the future.
"That's great," said Mr. Chang, nodding his head encouragingly.

The victory faith must be established. This faith, which is the foundation of army responsibility and dignity, was once established in extremely difficult conditions against a powerful enemy. I believe that the responsibility for the whole humanity and for Earth civilization can also support such a belief.
But how can we do the ideological work for our units, given the complex composition of our Space Force? " said an officer. "This makes our future ideological work more difficult."

“I think we should start with the spirit of our troops, ” said Zhang Baihai. “From a larger perspective, I investigated the daily training of recent addition to our Air Force and Navy Aviation Corps last week. It has been found that these units’ daily training are already very relaxed; from a smaller perspective, army discipline also appears more and more problems: Yesterday was the day to change into summer uniforms in our headquarters, but quite a few people still wore winter military attire.” “This kind of spirit must be changed soon. Nowadays, our Space Force is becoming increasingly academically oriented. Of course, we should recognize that it is currently performing the mission of a military academy, but we should also realize that we are an army in a state of war! ”

As the conversation went on for some time, Chang Bansai sat back into his seat. "Thank you all, I hope we can continue to have such honest exchanges in the future." He looked up once again and met Zhang Beihai's gaze, which was steady and unyielding. This made him feel a sense of relief.

Chapter Bei Hai, I know you have faith. You have a father who is also like this. It's impossible for you not to have faith, but I don't know how you formed your beliefs, or even what else they may contain beyond what you are saying. Like your father, I admire him very much, but I have to admit that at the end of the day, he also has many mysteries hidden deep in his mind that I could never understand.

Constant Wei Si opened the document in front of him. “At present, space war theory research has fully expanded, but soon encountered problems: interstellar war research must be based on technology development levels. But at present, each foundation research has just begun, and technological breakthroughs are still far away in the future. This makes our research lost its foundation. In order to adapt to this situation, headquarters have revised the study plan, dividing the original single space war theory research into independent three parts, adapting to various technological levels possible in the future human world: low-tech strategies, medium-tech strategies and high-tech strategies.”

At present, the work of defining three technological levels is ongoing, which involves determining a large number of indicators within major disciplines. However, its core parameters are the speed and navigable range for万吨级的 interstellar ships.

The low-tech level allows the spacecraft to have a speed of around 800 kilometers per second, which is about 50 times faster than third cosmic velocity. The spacecraft does not have an ecological recycle ability. Therefore, the combat range of the spacecraft will be limited in the solar system within 30 astronomical units from the sun.

The technical level of the ship is about 300 times the third cosmic velocity, which is 4800 kilometers per second. The ship has some ecological circulation ability. At this time, the operational radius of the ship will extend to the Koebel band (a region located outside the solar system with many small ice crystals in the disk-shaped form, which is 30－100 astronomical units away from the sun), and within 1000 astronomical units of the Sun.

“At the high technology level, the speed of the spaceship is about 1000 times faster than the third cosmic velocity, which is equal to 16000 km/s or about five percent of light speed. Thus, the spaceship can travel within the Orion Nebula (the nebular cloud around the sun consisting mainly of non-active comets). Initially, the spaceship has the capability for interstellar travel.”

The most serious threat to the space-armed forces is called "failureism", and it is the political workers of the armed forces who bear a tremendous mission, they should take part in the research on space military theory comprehensively and eliminate failureism.

“All members of today’s meeting will become the members of the space warfare theory group. Although there are overlapping parts in the research of these three theoretical branches, they are all independent institutions and their names are temporarily set as Low-tech Strategy Research Room, Medium-tech Strategy Research Room, and High-tech Strategy Research Room. The purpose of today’s meeting is to hear each one’s choice preferences for the next job arrangement of military department, which may be used as a reference. Let us all speak up about our choices.”

Of the thirty-two officers attending, twenty-four chose the Low-Tech Strategic Research Office, seven chose the Medium-Tech Strategic Research Office, and only one chose the High-Tech Strategic Research Office.
Seems like you're determined to become a science fiction fan.
I chose the only hope of victory, and to achieve this technological level, humans will have to build an effective defense system against Earth and the solar system.
“Even if we don't have the technology to control nuclear fusion, how could it be possible to propel a万吨 ship at 5% of light speed? Isn't this fantasy?”
"Not four centuries yet? We should look at the problem with a developing eye."
“However, the basic theory of physics is no longer possible to develop.”

“The existing potential of applying the theories may only be one percent, ” says Zhang Beihai. “I feel that the biggest problem now is the research strategies of science and technology communities in terms of technology, which spend a lot of resources and time on low-end technologies and even the same amount of resources to research new generations of chemical engines! There should be direct concentrated efforts in the development of fusion engines instead, without spending as much resource as they are currently doing. Moreover, the development of no fuel type fusion engine (a fusion engine that uses nuclear fusion radiant energy directly to propel a spacecraft; a fuel-type fusion engine requires carrying a mass of fuel when accelerating or decelerating for a long period of time, which makes it impossible to carry out interplanetary voyages) should be pursued as soon as possible.”

“Chang Beihai commented that at least one question raised by him deserves attention: both military and scientific circles are busy with their work, but there is inadequate communication between them. Fortunately, they have all realized this situation and organized a joint meeting of military and scientific circles, setting up specialized agencies for better exchanges among them. Next, we will send many military representatives to various research areas, while also inviting a large number of scientists involved in space warfare theory research. The words remain the same: We cannot sit back and wait for technology breakthroughs; instead, we should form our own strategic thinking system as soon as possible so as to promote research in all fields.”
“The faceless ones?” someone asked, surprised. “They want to interfere with the Space Force’s operations?”

“At this point, there is no indication that anything like this has happened. However, we should be aware that they have some power to investigate it and might unexpectedly impact our work if interference does occur. Thus, we need to be prepared for the possibility of a balancing between defensive maneuvers and face-saving plans.”
After the meeting, Chang Wei Si sat alone in an empty conference room. He lit a cigarette and watched the sunlight shining through the window into the smoke, like burning flames.
Anyway, it's all started. He told himself.

Rouge experienced for the first time a feeling of dream coming true. He thought that Galine's promise was just bullshit, but he did find an untouched beauty here and they were quite similar to what he had painted on his map. However, when he stepped down from the helicopter, he felt like he was entering his dream: distant snow-covered mountains, before him lakes, beside which was grasslands and forests. The place's purity was beyond his imagination; everything here looked so fresh as if it had just come out of a fairy tale with sweet fragrance in the air.

$Even the sun seemed to be shy, scattering its most gentle and beautiful part of light here. The most amazing thing is that there's a small estate with a villa as its center near the lake. According to Kent, who accompanied me, this building was built in the late 19th century but it seems older than that. It has been blended into the environment due to its ancientness.
Don't be surprised, sometimes people dream of places that actually exist.
“Is there anyone living here?” LuoJi asked.
There are no towns or villages within five kilometers of this point, but there are a few small villages further away.
Logical inference, he doesn't ask.

Kent led Luo Zhuge into the villa, and he saw a large-sized European-style living room. Luo Zhuge looked at the fireplace in the living room, next to which were wooden blocks整齐ly stacked, and they were emitting a pleasant scent of wood burning up.

Kant said, “The former owner of the mansion greets you.” He went on to tell Loki that in addition to what he had asked for, there were more facilities in the estate: a stall with ten horses so that one could go for walks on the mountains by horseback; a tennis court and a golf course, as well as a wine cellar, a boat on the lake and some sailboats. The exterior of the ancient-looking mansion was completely modernized, each room had a computer, broadband network and satellite TV, and there was also a digital movie screening room. In addition to all this, Loki noticed that the helicopter landing pad was clearly not temporary.
“Is this person rich?”

“Not only does he not want to reveal his identity, otherwise I might have known his name. …He has gifted the land and its building to the United Nations. The amount of land he donated is more than what John D. Rockefeller had given before. So it must be noted that both the land and its buildings belong to the United Nations now, and you only have the right to stay in this villa. But besides that, the remaining items from his house, such as these paintings, are also yours.”

Kant带着 Rousseau to inspect the rooms of the villa. When Rousseau sees the original owner's taste, he is impressed by the harmony in every room that conveys a feeling of sophistication. The books in the study are mostly in Latin language. Those paintings in the room are modern-style but they don't disturb the harmonious atmosphere in this classical villa. Rousseau noticed the lack of landscape pictures on the walls which is very mature: this house is located in a paradise, and the landscape pictures hanging here is like adding water to the sea.

Back in the living room, Luo Ge sat down on the comfortable rocking chair near the fireplace and took something from a small table nearby. It was a pipe, an uncommon and delicate type with an extended stem and handle, typically used by the upper classes. He looked up at the white frames on the walls and imagined what had just been removed there.

When Kante led in a few people and introduced them, they were the butler, chef, driver, stableman, yacht captain, etc., who had served their previous owners. After these people left, Kante introduced a security officer in civilian dress as responsible for keeping order on this property. The officer then walked away. Rook asked where Shiqiang was.
“He has handed over your security duties and he might be going back to China.”
I think he's more suitable to take the place of that major.
I also have this feeling, but he doesn't understand English and it's inconvenient for work.
"Then let's change the guards here to be all Chinese."
Kante agreed to contact them and went out.

$Rousseau also walked out of the room, passed through the finely decorated lawn and went to a bridge leading to the lake. At the end of the bridge, he reached out and looked at his mirror-like reflections in the lake, surrounded by fresh air and bright sunshine. Rousseau thought to himself: compared to the present world, how does the world 400 years later count?
Fuck the man walls.
“How can this bastard be allowed to enter?” a researcher whispered in front of the terminal.
Of course the wall-sitter can come in.
"Is that all there is to it? Just so dull and predictable, Mr. President? " said Dr. Allen, head of the Los Alamos National Laboratory, as he walked by a row of computer screens with Radiaz.
I am no longer president.
This is one of the nuclear simulation centers, there are four such centers in Los Alamos and three in Livermore.

Reyez saw two things that were a little more exciting than usual. Those gadgets looked brand new, with a huge display and many refined handles on the console as well. He rushed to have a closer look but was pulled back by Allen. "This is a game console, it's there so people can relax while they rest," he explained.

Reyez saw two more things that were a bit different. They were transparent and very complex, with liquid swirling inside them. This time Ellen shrugged instead of stopping him as he moved on. “That’s a humidifier, and the other thing is just an automatic coffee maker… McCoy, give Mr. Reyez some coffee. No, don’t make it from there; go to my office and get brewed coffee out of freshly ground beans.”

Radiatz had to look at the big black-and-white photos on the wall, but even if he recognized the thin man with a top hat and a pipe on his lap was Mr. Orbanheimer, Alan still pointed him to the plain-looking terminals.
These monitors are too old.
But they are behind the world's most powerful computers, which can perform 500 trillion floating point operations per second.
“This time, an engineer came up to me and said: ‘Doctor, AD44530G model works this time.’”
"Fine, thank you."
The engineer speaks in a low voice. "We've had to suspend the output module, sir." He looks at Rediatz.
Alan said, "Let's run." He turned to Rediaz and added, "You see there is nothing to hide from the opposite side.

Reyes heard a hissing sound and saw that people were tearing up their documents. He thought they were destroying the files, but he quickly noticed that those tearing the papers were actually shredding blank sheets of paper. Nobody called out: “Stop”. At this point, somebody shouted “Over”, and everybody threw the torn-up pieces onto the already disorganized floor in an impromptued cheer.

“This is a tradition of the simulation center. When the first nuclear bomb was detonated, Fermi once released pieces of paper in the air and calculated the detonation effects by tracking them flying distance with exact accuracy.”

Radias slapped the paper on his head and shoulders, saying, “You guys are having nuclear tests every day like playing video games. But we can't; we don't have a supercomputer; we can only do the same thing, which makes us annoying…
Mr. Radiz, no one here is interested in politics.

Radias cautiously approached several terminals, only to find that all he saw was rolling data and fluctuating curves. Finally, he saw a graph or image that he could identify, but it was abstracted and unrecognizable. When Radias went to take a closer look at one of the terminals, the physicist in front of him raised his head and said, “President, do you want to see an atomic cloud? No, I don’t have it.”
"I'm not the president," Rydiaz replied as she received the coffee that McKeon had handed her.
